page.title: 09Hutton & Shenfield,a history
page.content: In 1793, the area was described as a populous place, with good inns chiefly maintained by the multitude of passengers and carriers passing along the Roman road from Colchester to London. The great Mr.McAdam himself worked on the Shenfield to Chelmsford road in 1833, and now this road is connected to the London Orbital M25 motorway. In 1843, when the Eastern Counties Railway opened, people began commuting the 18 miles to London, where they coluld work within the capital of the country but yet live in countryside with all of the modern facilities of a town. At Hutton the Rayleigh Road from Shenfield to Billericay was once known as Hutton Street.Here on The Mount, near Shenfield, large houses were built and Hutton itself supplied the servants for the wealthy.
